question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned the mechanism behind cameras and how light works to produce images. I learned to use and shoot with a film camera, including the technical and aesthetic aspects of black and white photography. Developed an eye for light, composition and emotional content to drive artistic and documentary storytelling. Learned darkroom techniques such as film processing, printing, burning and dodging and scanning. Discussion of black-and-white photography in seminar setting as well as notable works by photographers in the past and present.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Ive learned how to enlarge, print, use contrast filters, spot and tone, and so much more. This class was phenomenal.

developing black&white photographs 
way of framing pics

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
- 35 mm film photography
- developing films

- printing techniques

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: This course provided a great basis for learning how to take black and white photos, and specifically film. We learned about the various components of an image such as emotional context and light and how to use a camera (i.e., ISO, shutter speed, and aperture).

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned darkroom practices of processing and developing film. I expanded my knowledge of photography and what makes a strong image. I learned how to better shoot black and white.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I definitely developed a much more well rounded set of darkroom skills and it was great to be forced to shoot black and white which was always something that I never did too much of. I've definitely looked at prints in a new light knowing all the things that I could do to it.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: We learned a lot of technical skills in this course, including how to work a film camera, load film, develop film, and print in the darkroom. We also practice talking about our own work and the work of others, both critically and constructively, whether it be famous photographers or our fellow classmates. Additionally, beyond this, in this course, we developed a new way of looking at our surroundings and situations.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I became more familiar with darkroom printing techniques like dodging, burning, and contrast filters. I also learned about different photographers and became more confident in shooting portraits.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Learned how to use a film camera, how to develop film, print/dodge/burn in the darkroom, and got to see a lot of work from famous B&W photographers

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
1. Learned the new skill of shooting photos in black and white with film, which I have never done before.
2. Learned how to develop film and print photos in a darkroom.
3. Learned how to work with light, composition, and content to create good photos.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Susie was an excellent teacher, mentor and professional photographer who emphasized not only the technical aspects of film photography but also the aesthetic and emotional component of what made images compelling. She draws from her experiences to teach us the workflow and process of film developing, processing and printing. I enjoyed her anecdotes working for newspapers and Nat Geo as well as her one-on-one mentoring that allowed me to appreciate black-and-white as a medium of art. Susie was always willing to spend time talking about problems we were facing and devoted time for office hours to make herself as available as possible.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Susie was always available to meet and was incredibly supportive of our ideas and visions. She is the best.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: having a better best picutre

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text:
- I really found the extra lab hours helpful in the beginning of the semester, as there is a lot of techniques to learn
- I liked having 3 critiques throughout the semester where we all showed our work and gave feedback to each other. It really helped us improve.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Susie was a great instructor in that she took time to help us with whatever we needed. She was widely available outside of class time to look at work, and was very involved in our process. We also spent class time looking at photographers and Susie's work which I appreciated.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Susie was very available and willing to help us. She was incredibly receptive to our feedback and asked about the course and our opinions throughout the semester. I thought that the labs were helpful at the begining of the semester.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I liked the freedom Susie gave us to do our own thing and I think it allowed for a lot of creative freedom and development of our own styles. Susie was also very generous with her time and was very accessible.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I think Susie made the classroom environment really collaborative and friendly, which was very valuable when we were all crammed in the darkroom at once or helping each other out late into the night in the days before a critique. I think having the labs at the beginning of the semester were good to be able to learn most of the technical skills in a smaller environment given the nature of these tasks and the small spaces we needed to work in.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I think the course was a great balance between learning through lecture/presentations about different techniques and styles of photography, and learning by actually practicing photography. The instructor was great very available to provide feedback on our work, which was really helpful, and I enjoyed the critiques and seeing everyone's work.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Susie was amazing. There was a LOT to do and learn in this class, so some weeks were quite chaotic, but Susie always made time to help us through weekly office hours and additional one-on-one time. She once came in on a Saturday to give me her thoughts on my photos. I also loved how hands-on this class was; there was a good mix of lectures and developing/printing time.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Office hours and critiques were great opportunities to improve my own works and also to learn from the good works of others.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: Both artistic appreciation of notable works and practical application of film photography to portrait, landscape, and documentary subjects. Process of film processing was sometimes daunting and time-consuming but always magical to see your prints come to life. I always come to appreciate the final prints given the amount of time and effort they take.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: It was extremely stimulating and I learned so much!

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The critiques were so helpful

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: There was a lot of new information in this course, from how to use a film camera, to printing photos and more detailed techniques such as dodging and burning. The limits were nearly endless in this class as we were not given specific assignments and there was plenty of room to explore.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: Critiques and discussing my work and the work of my classmates were stimulating.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: I thought it was very helpful to look at work that was great but not necessarily "historically significant" like looking at work that was by regular people instead of say Sally Mann or Cartier Bresson. Obviously it's important to look at these major works too but also it's a lot more relatable to see regular people's work.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: I think the nature of this class and the hands-on art we are creating make this class inherently stimulating. I also enjoyed the photographer presentations and talking through images (like what we did on the quiz).

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: I think all aspects of the course were very engaging; I enjoyed making pinhole photos, learning and presenting about different photographers, practicing portrait photography, seeing everyone's work during critiques, etc. I really enjoyed the freedom that came with not really having assignments for what to take photos of, but at the same time I think it could have been helpful for growing as a photographer to have to shoot certain subjects/styles/projects.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: I got to learn a totally new skill in this class, so the whole course was stimulating.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: There were several classes where we had photographers coming in and sharing their works and insights with us, which were very inspiring.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Definitely one of the most interesting and exciting classes I've taken at Duke. Film photography and black and white is becoming harder and harder to learn in the digital age so I thought learning the tradition and technique with Susie was the best that could happen. The class, with its emphasis on technical and artistic aspects of photography, complements Susie's other classes, which focus on digital photography in documentary and storytelling settings. Susie wants to develop relationships with students and guide them along the process so although sometimes film can be overwhelming, she made it comforting and enjoyable.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: TAKE THIS CLASS! However, I would definitely recommend having some general background in photography and or darkroom techniques beforehand. This class is definitely demanding but is so interesting.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: just take it, you gonna love it, there are no courses like this at Duke, it's the only one

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: It's a lot of time commitment. And as someone who had 0 film photography/darkroom experience, I would say that the beginning of the semester where you learn all the techniques/processes will be very hard. But once you practice more and get the hang of it, it's extremely rewarding. I would say if you want to do well in the class, you should be able to spare a good amount of time (could even be 10 hrs/week sometimes).

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: This is a great course if you are beginner or not when it comes to photography or film specifically. Susie is a great professor and invested in our success.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Expect to spend a lot of time in the darkroom. Printing (and processing) can be very tedious. I personally enjoy it, but it definitley takes far more time than I could have expected.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: You get out what you put in! It can be time-consuming, but it is so rewarding. Seeing your print turn out after all the effort put into the whole process feels amazing.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: This course is a great way to learn how to shoot, develop, and print black and white film photography. It takes a decent amount of time outside of class, but it's really fun and the instructor provides helpful feedback to help you improve.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: If you're interested in film photography, I would 100% recommend this course. Easily one of the best I've taken in my 4 years at Duke.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: I strongly recommend this course. Learning film and working extensively with light made me a better digital photographer. It completely changed my perspectives about photography in a good way, and reinforced my love with photography.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
I learned about photographic research and about examples of past projects that have been conducted. 
I learned about how to think critically about photos and to not just accept them as they are but to consider the photographer-subject relationship, as well as what stories are not being told in the frame of the photo. 
I learned that, oftentimes, photos elicit more questions than answers and it is important to consider what stories are being told, but also to determine which ones are not told.

response_text: I definitely developed a much more well rounded set of darkroom skills and it was great to be forced to shoot black and white which was always something that I never did too much of. I've definitely looked at prints in a new light knowing all the things that I could do to it.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: We learned a lot of technical skills in this course, including how to work a film camera, load film, develop film, and print in the darkroom. We also practice talking about our own work and the work of others, both critically and constructively, whether it be famous photographers or our fellow classmates. Additionally, beyond this, in this course, we developed a new way of looking at our surroundings and situations.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I became more familiar with darkroom printing techniques like dodging, burning, and contrast filters. I also learned about different photographers and became more confident in shooting portraits.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Learned how to use a film camera, how to develop film, print/dodge/burn in the darkroom, and got to see a lot of work from famous B&W photographers

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
1. Learned the new skill of shooting photos in black and white with film, which I have never done before.
2. Learned how to develop film and print photos in a darkroom.
3. Learned how to work with light, composition, and content to create good photos.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Susie was an excellent teacher, mentor and professional photographer who emphasized not only the technical aspects of film photography but also the aesthetic and emotional component of what made images compelling. She draws from her experiences to teach us the workflow and process of film developing, processing and printing. I enjoyed her anecdotes working for newspapers and Nat Geo as well as her one-on-one mentoring that allowed me to appreciate black-and-white as a medium of art. Susie was always willing to spend time talking about problems we were facing and devoted time for office hours to make herself as available as possible.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Susie was always available to meet and was incredibly supportive of our ideas and visions. She is the best.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text:
- I really found the extra lab hours helpful in the beginning of the semester, as there is a lot of techniques to learn
- I liked having 3 critiques throughout the semester where we all showed our work and gave feedback to each other. It really helped us improve.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Susie was a great instructor in that she took time to help us with whatever we needed. She was widely available outside of class time to look at work, and was very involved in our process. We also spent class time looking at photographers and Susie's work which I appreciated.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Susie was very available and willing to help us. She was incredibly receptive to our feedback and asked about the course and our opinions throughout the semester. I thought that the labs were helpful at the begining of the semester.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I liked the freedom Susie gave us to do our own thing and I think it allowed for a lot of creative freedom and development of our own styles. Susie was also very generous with her time and was very accessible.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I think Susie made the classroom environment really collaborative and friendly, which was very valuable when we were all crammed in the darkroom at once or helping each other out late into the night in the days before a critique. I think having the labs at the beginning of the semester were good to be able to learn most of the technical skills in a smaller environment given the nature of these tasks and the small spaces we needed to work in.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I think the course was a great balance between learning through lecture/presentations about different techniques and styles of photography, and learning by actually practicing photography. The instructor was great very available to provide feedback on our work, which was really helpful, and I enjoyed the critiques and seeing everyone's work.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Susie was amazing. There was a LOT to do and learn in this class, so some weeks were quite chaotic, but Susie always made time to help us through weekly office hours and additional one-on-one time. She once came in on a Saturday to give me her thoughts on my photos. I also loved how hands-on this class was; there was a good mix of lectures and developing/printing time.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

I always come to appreciate the final prints given the amount of time and effort they take.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: I think all aspects of the course were very engaging; I enjoyed making pinhole photos, learning and presenting about different photographers, practicing portrait photography, seeing everyone's work during critiques, etc. I really enjoyed the freedom that came with not really having assignments for what to take photos of, but at the same time I think it could have been helpful for growing as a photographer to have to shoot certain subjects/styles/projects.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Definitely one of the most interesting and exciting classes I've taken at Duke. Film photography and black and white is becoming harder and harder to learn in the digital age so I thought learning the tradition and technique with Susie was the best that could happen. The class, with its emphasis on technical and artistic aspects of photography, complements Susie's other classes, which focus on digital photography in documentary and storytelling settings. Susie wants to develop relationships with students and guide them along the process so although sometimes film can be overwhelming, she made it comforting and enjoyable.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: TAKE THIS CLASS! However, I would definitely recommend having some general background in photography and or darkroom techniques beforehand. This class is definitely demanding but is so interesting.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: just take it, you gonna love it, there are no courses like this at Duke, it's the only one

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: It's a lot of time commitment. And as someone who had 0 film photography/darkroom experience, I would say that the beginning of the semester where you learn all the techniques/processes will be very hard. But once you practice more and get the hang of it, it's extremely rewarding. I would say if you want to do well in the class, you should be able to spare a good amount of time (could even be 10 hrs/week sometimes).

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: This is a great course if you are beginner or not when it comes to photography or film specifically. Susie is a great professor and invested in our success.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Expect to spend a lot of time in the darkroom. Printing (and processing) can be very tedious. I personally enjoy it, but it definitley takes far more time than I could have expected.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: You get out what you put in! It can be time-consuming, but it is so rewarding. Seeing your print turn out after all the effort put into the whole process feels amazing.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: This course is a great way to learn how to shoot, develop, and print black and white film photography. It takes a decent amount of time outside of class, but it's really fun and the instructor provides helpful feedback to help you improve.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: If you're interested in film photography, I would 100% recommend this course. Easily one of the best I've taken in my 4 years at Duke.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: I strongly recommend this course. Learning film and working extensively with light made me a better digital photographer. It completely changed my perspectives about photography in a good way, and reinforced my love with photography.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
I learned about photographic research and about examples of past projects that have been conducted. 
I learned about how to think critically about photos and to not just accept them as they are but to consider the photographer-subject relationship, as well as what stories are not being told in the frame of the photo. 
I learned that, oftentimes, photos elicit more questions than answers and it is important to consider what stories are being told, but also to determine which ones are not told.
